abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s chairman, James Dimon, told shareholders at Tuesday’s annual meeting that his firm is coming off what may have been its “finest year ever,” listing its achievements in a period when some of its largest competitors fell or were acquired by JPMorgan itself.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s chairman, James Dimon, told shareholders at Tuesday’s annual meeting that his firm is coming off what may have been its “finest year ever,” listing its achievements in a period when some of its largest competitors fell or were acq...
lead_paragraph: Update | 2:08 p.m.  Wall Street is still reeling from one of the most wrenching periods in its history. But for Jamie Dimon, the head of the banking giant JPMorgan Chase, it was the firm’s shining moment.

headline.main: Jamie Dimon on the ‘Traumatic TARP Experience’
